article.headline: Niagara 80, Central Michigan 73
article.story: MOUNT PLEASANT, Mich. (AP) -- Charron Fisher scored 23 points and Lorenzo Miles had 19 points and 10 rebounds in Niagara's 80-73 victory over Central Michigan on Saturday. Suburban Detroit native Clif Brown added 18 points and Stanley Hodge had nine assists off the bench for the Purple Eagles (4-6), who won their third straight. There were eight ties and 18 lead changes before Fisher put Niagara ahead to stay, 46-45, with a dunk with 12:58 left to play. The visitors twice extended their lead to 12 points but the Chippewas (4-7) stayed close, moving to within 76-73 on a 3-pointer by freshman Jordan Bitzer with 25 seconds remaining. Bitzer fouled out after the change of possession and Brown hit two free throws to put Niagara ahead 78-73. Fisher added two free throws with 14 seconds to go. Bitzer finished with six 3-pointers and 18 points, both career highs. Giordan Watson led Central Michigan with 19 points, but only two in the second half. Sefton Barrett added 15 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
